org.apache.flink.runtime.jobmanager.scheduler

Class DefaultScheduler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.runtime.jobmanager.scheduler.DefaultScheduler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExecutionStageListener, JobStatusListener, InstanceListener

    public class DefaultScheduler
extends Object
implements InstanceListener, JobStatusListener, ExecutionStageListener
    The default scheduler for Nephele. While Nephele's JobManager is responsible for requesting the required instances for the job at the InstanceManager, the scheduler is in charge of assigning the individual tasks to the instances.

    • Field Summary

      The LOG object to report events within the scheduler.

      • DefaultScheduler

        public DefaultScheduler(DeploymentManager deploymentManager,
                        InstanceManager instanceManager)
        Constructs a new abstract scheduler.
        Parameters:
        deploymentManager - the deployment manager assigned to this scheduler
        instanceManager - the instance manager to be used with this scheduler

    • Method Detail

      • scheduleJob

        public void scheduleJob(ExecutionGraph executionGraph)
                 throws SchedulingException
        Adds a job represented by an ExecutionGraph object to the scheduler. The job is then executed according to the strategies of the concrete scheduler implementation.
        Parameters:
        executionGraph - the job to be added to the scheduler
        Throws:
        SchedulingException - thrown if an error occurs and the scheduler does not accept the new job

      • getExecutionGraphByID

        public ExecutionGraph getExecutionGraphByID(JobID jobID)
        Returns the execution graph which is associated with the given job ID.
        Parameters:
        jobID - the job ID to search the execution graph for
        Returns:
        the execution graph which belongs to the given job ID or null

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts the scheduler down. After shut down no jobs can be added to the scheduler.

      • jobStatusHasChanged

      • nextExecutionStageEntered

        public void nextExecutionStageEntered(JobID jobID,
                                      ExecutionStage executionStage)
        Description copied from interface: ExecutionStageListener
        This method is called to indicate that the job with the given JobID has finished its previous ExecutionStage and has entered the next ExecutionStage. Note that a notification is not sent when the job has entered its initial execution stage.
        Specified by:
        nextExecutionStageEntered in interface ExecutionStageListener
        Parameters:
        jobID - the ID of the job the notification belongs to
        executionStage - the next execution stage that has just been entered

      • getInstanceManager

        public InstanceManager getInstanceManager()
        Returns the InstanceManager object which is used by the current scheduler.
        Returns:
        the InstanceManager object which is used by the current scheduler

      • requestInstances

        protected void requestInstances(ExecutionStage executionStage)
                         throws InstanceException
        Collects the instances required to run the job from the given ExecutionStage and requests them at the loaded instance manager.
        Parameters:
        executionStage - the execution stage to collect the required instances from
        Throws:
        InstanceException - thrown if the given execution graph is already processing its final stage

      • deployAssignedVertices

        public void deployAssignedVertices(ExecutionVertex startVertex)
        Collects all execution vertices with the state ASSIGNED starting from the given start vertex and deploys them on the assigned AllocatedResource objects.
        Parameters:
        startVertex - the execution vertex to start the deployment from

      • deployAssignedPipeline

        public void deployAssignedPipeline(ExecutionPipeline pipeline)
        Collects all execution vertices with the state ASSIGNED from the given pipeline and deploys them on the assigned AllocatedResource objects.
        Parameters:
        pipeline - the execution pipeline to be deployed

      • deployAssignedVertices

        public void deployAssignedVertices(Collection<ExecutionVertex> startVertices)
        Collects all execution vertices with the state ASSIGNED starting from the given collection of start vertices and deploys them on the assigned AllocatedResource objects.
        Parameters:
        startVertices - the collection of execution vertices to start the deployment from

      • deployAssignedInputVertices

        public void deployAssignedInputVertices(ExecutionGraph executionGraph)
        Collects all execution vertices with the state ASSIGNED starting from the input vertices of the current execution stage and deploys them on the assigned AllocatedResource objects.
        Parameters:
        executionGraph - the execution graph to collect the vertices from

      • resourcesAllocated

        public void resourcesAllocated(JobID jobID,
                               List<AllocatedResource> allocatedResources)
        Description copied from interface: InstanceListener
        Called if one or more requested resources have become available.
        Specified by:
        resourcesAllocated in interface InstanceListener
        Parameters:
        jobID - the ID of the job the initial request has been triggered for
        allocatedResources - the resources which have been allocated as a response to the initial request

      • checkAndReleaseAllocatedResource

        public void checkAndReleaseAllocatedResource(ExecutionGraph executionGraph,
                                             AllocatedResource allocatedResource)
        Checks if the given AllocatedResource is still required for the execution of the given execution graph. If the resource is no longer assigned to a vertex that is either currently running or about to run the given resource is returned to the instance manager for deallocation.
        Parameters:
        executionGraph - the execution graph the provided resource has been used for so far
        allocatedResource - the allocated resource to check the assignment for

      • replayCheckpointsFromPreviousStage

        protected void replayCheckpointsFromPreviousStage(ExecutionGraph executionGraph)

      • allocatedResourcesDied

        public void allocatedResourcesDied(JobID jobID,
                                   List<AllocatedResource> allocatedResources)
        Description copied from interface: InstanceListener
        Called if one or more allocated resources assigned to at least one job have died unexpectedly.
        Specified by:
        allocatedResourcesDied in interface InstanceListener
        Parameters:
        jobID - the ID of the job the instance is used for
        allocatedResources - the allocated resources which are affected by the instance death
